title: Frost Possible Later This Week
text:
Frost Possible Later This Week October 13, 2015, 6:22 PM by Brian Karstens SIOUX FALLS, SD - 
Signs are growing that a frost and a possible freeze is headed for much of KELOLAND later this week. 
Remember, a frost advisory is issued when conditions are favorable for temperatures to drop between 33 and 36, resulting in widespread frost near the ground. 
A freeze warning will be issued if temperatures drop below 32. In particular, a hard freeze is defined by temperatures at 28 degrees or lower for 3 consecutive hours. 
We may come close to some of those conditions. By Friday morning, 30 degree weather is likely through a big part of KELOLAND. Folks in the north will be coldest with 20s likely in Aberdeen. 
We think Sioux Falls will have the coldest weather by Saturday morning. A drier environment will help the cooling process, and with clear skies and light winds in the forecast, odds are favorable that you'll need to cover a few plants you want to protect later in the week.
